SENT.plain: Astrocytosis is a sequential morphological change of astrocytic reaction to tissue damage, and is associated with regulation of antioxidant defense mechanisms to reduce oxidative damage

The repair enzymes to oxidative DNA damage, oxidized purine-nucleoside triphosphatase (hMTH1) and a mitochondrial type of 8-oxoguanine DNA glycosylase (hOGG1-2a) in brain tumors and neurons of Alzheimer's disease, were previously reported
In the present study, glial expression of these repair enzymes under such pathological conditions as cerebrovascular diseases and metastatic brain tumors, were investigated
Furthermore, an in-vitro experiment using a glioma cell-line under oxidative stress was performed to verify the immunohistochemical results of post-mortem materials
As a result, hOGG1-2a immunoreactivities in reactive astrocytes were more intense than those to hMTH1
Oligodendrocytes of acute or subacute stage of brain infarction were strongly immunoreactive to both repair enzymes
In-vitro study revealed that, hOGG1-2a is constitutively expressed in both untreated glioma cells and the glioma cells under oxidative stress
However, although no immunoreactivity to hMTH1 was found in the control cells, accumulation of hMTH1 was rapidly induced by oxidative stress

These results indicate that the two repair enzymes to oxidative DNA damage are differentially regulated in glial cells, and that there is a difference in the expression of the repair enzymes between reactive astrocytes and oligodendrocytes
